resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

fields.summary: Remote SC initiates LDAP Sync Upon Start Up

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Setup*

2 x CLC, Walrus
1 x CC, SC
2 x NC

*Issue*

cloud-output.log files on both CLC+Walrus and CC+SC machine show LDAP login failure:

Why does cloud-output.log on the SC show the error?  Isn't all LDAP information synced to the CLC database?  If so, what is the reason for the error on the SC?
fields.summary: Why does LDAP log error appear on remote SC?

comments.body:
Information from LIC template file regarding auth-credentials parameter:

<auth-credentials> field can have both un-encrypted and encrypted password. Encrypted password has a format as \{RSA/ECB/PKCS1Padding\} xxxxxxxxxxxxx.

"auth-credentials":"ENCRYPTED_PASSWORD"

Error in cloud-output.log:

{code}
2013-01-14 14:10:29 ERROR | javax.naming.AuthenticationException: [LDAP: error code 49 - 80090308: LdapErr: DSID-0C0903A9, comment: AcceptSecurityContext error, data 52e, v1db1^@]

Additional question - In the Administration Guide, instructions to create the LIC file are as follows:

{code}
To start a LIC file:

Enter the following command:

/usr/sbin/euca-lictool --password secret --out example.lic

The above command invokes the LIC tool to create a template LIC and fill in the encrypted password for authenticating to LDAP/AD service (i.e. the password of the administrative user for accessing the LDAP/AD during synchronization). The LIC toolâ€™s primary functions are to encrypt the LDAP/AD password and to generate the starting LIC template. The usage of the LIC tool shows different ways to invoke the command.
{code}

Does the format of the --password value have to be plain text?
Harold, can you confirm then that we do work and support encrypted password and this was just a user error?

Hey Darren,

Confirmation was provided in SUP-179.  Is there any additional information needed?  Let me know and I can touch base with Tier 2 on this.  Additionally, do we have a test in QA that tests this?  If so, we should make sure that it tests the encrypted password in the LIC file.  

The question here is if there is a bad value put in for the auth-credentials variable in the LIC file on the CLC, why does an error show up on remote SC logs?

Let me know if there is a need for additional information.

Cheers,

Harold Spencer, Jr.
Do you have copies of both the CLC and SC logs? I only see one log and I don't know which machine that is from.

Without the SC logs I can't really take further action. The SC should not be doing any LDAP sync at all. The CLC log indicated that the customer is using the Token Service and the verification of a token was causing a lookup for LDAP credentials and triggering an LDAP sync, which obviously failed because the login failed.

The SC should not be processing any requests that use Tokens or any external user requests at all. The SC only takes SOAP messages from the CLC that are authenticated using the cloud internal certificate.

So, in short, I'm not sure how this would be happening on the SC, and without logs I can't really look at this particular instance. If you get more information or can get the SC logs then please let me know and I can continue further investigation.

Hello Zach.

SC and CLC logs are attached.

Tested environment:
1x CLC/Walrus
1x CC/SC

Hey [~zhill],

We have any update on this?  Did you need any additional information here?  Let us know if you need more info here.  Thanks.
Resolving as a duplicate of EUCA-7102. The fix for that issue stops LDAP identity synchronization running on the storage controller (or any other host that is not the coordinator)

Reopening this issue because I saw this in my 3.4 multi-cluster cloud when I started the storage controller that was on a remote machine.
